result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian A. Segura

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Attorney Jay Heit at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 11/04/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:16 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian A. Segura in court without counsel. Defendant is advised of charges and possible penalties. Defendant states he has representation on other Eau Claire County matters. Court advises that he contact the Public Defender's Office to discuss further.

Status Conference set for 11/17/2022 at 11:00 AM with Rusk County Judge Barna. (To ride along with 22CT171, 22CF538, 22CT186, 22CT140 already scheduled)

ADDRESS INFO for Brian A. Segura
Current: 2650 Mercantile Drive, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: 117 N Wisconsin St, Fall Creek, WI 54742

records.addlTxt: Notice of Assignment of Judge - Unable to Forward per USPS

Conditions: 
No contact with T.S., K.P. or their residences.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.

(11:25 AM case called.) Defendant Brian A. Segura appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Brian A. Segura. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Attorney Anderson advises the defendant didn't apply for Public Defender representation.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on September 14, 2022 at 1:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
